00025 #include "wiring_private.h"
00026 #include "pins_arduino.h"
00027 
00028 /* Measures the length (in microseconds) of a pulse on the pin; state is HIGH
00029  * or LOW, the type of pulse to measure.  Works on pulses from 2-3 microseconds
00030  * to 3 minutes in length, but must be called at least a few dozen microseconds
00031  * before the start of the pulse. */
00032 unsigned long pulseIn(uint8_t pin, uint8_t state, unsigned long timeout)
00033 {
00034         // cache the port and bit of the pin in order to speed up the
00035         // pulse width measuring loop and achieve finer resolution.  calling
00036         // digitalRead() instead yields much coarser resolution.
00037         uint8_t bit = digitalPinToBitMask(pin);
00038         uint8_t port = digitalPinToPort(pin);
00039         uint8_t stateMask = (state ? bit : 0);
00040         unsigned long width = 0; // keep initialization out of time critical area
00041         
00042         // convert the timeout from microseconds to a number of times through
00043         // the initial loop; it takes 16 clock cycles per iteration.
00044         unsigned long numloops = 0;
00045         unsigned long maxloops = microsecondsToClockCycles(timeout) / 16;
00046         
00047         // wait for any previous pulse to end
00048         while ((*portInputRegister(port) & bit) == stateMask)
00049                 if (numloops++ == maxloops)
00050                         return 0;
00051         
00052         // wait for the pulse to start
00053         while ((*portInputRegister(port) & bit) != stateMask)
00054                 if (numloops++ == maxloops)
00055                         return 0;
00056         
00057         // wait for the pulse to stop
00058         while ((*portInputRegister(port) & bit) == stateMask) {
00059                 if (numloops++ == maxloops)
00060                         return 0;
00061                 width++;
00062         }
00063 
00064         // convert the reading to microseconds. The loop has been determined
00065         // to be 20 clock cycles long and have about 16 clocks between the edge
00066         // and the start of the loop. There will be some error introduced by
00067         // the interrupt handlers.
00068         return clockCyclesToMicroseconds(width * 21 + 16); 
00069 }
